result.execSummary:
The defendant Sean R Wolfe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Child Pornography [Modifiers: Repeater], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography [Modifiers: Repeater], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: sentence Defendant is currently serving.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Defendant shall obtain/maintain full-time employment and or school.

Defendant shall not possess any type of pornographic picture, image, video or literature.  
Defendant shall have no contact with anyone under the age of eighteen without prior agent approval.  
Defendant shall not possess or use a computer or any technology with internet capabilities without prior agent approval.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent.  
Defendant shall maintain a stable residence.
Defendant shall undergo sex offender treatment and follow through with any recommended treatment.  
Defendant shall undergo sex offender registration.
Defendant shall pay Dept. of Corrections supervision fees.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Count 7 and any other sentence

superMiscConds.notes:
Defendant shall provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.

lf extended supervision is revoked and the defendant will have a mandatory release from prison, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall have no contact with anyone under 18 years of age unless approved by the agent.

Defendant shall have no internet access or any device with internet access unless approved by the agent.

Defendant shall not view any adult or child pornography.

Defendant shall not frequent areas where children congregate without agent approval.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent, including but not limited to sex offender treatment, and comply with treatment recommendations.

Defendant shall comply with sex offender registration.

supervisions.notes: The court vacated the sentence of December 20, 2016 for Count 4 and Count 7 and resentenced the defendant.
Consecutive to: any sentence Defendant is serving.

superMiscConds.notes: All conditions of Extended Supervision shall remain the same for probation.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

All conditions of Extended Supervison imposed in Ct. 4 shall remain the same as conditions of probation for Ct. 7.
Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent.
Defendant shall maintain a stable residence.
Defendant shall undergo sex offender treatment and follow through with any recommended treatment.
Defendant shall undergo sex offender registration.
Defendant shall pay Dept. of Corrections supervision fees.
Defendant shall obtain/maintain full-time employment and or school.

Defendant shall not possess any type of pornographic picture, image, video or literature.
Defendant shall have no contact with anyone under the age of eighteen without prior agent approval.
Defendant shall not possess or use a computer or any technology with internet capabilities without prior agent approval.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Count 4 and any other sentence

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant shall provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.
All conditions of Extended Supervision in Count 4 are inclusive of Count 7.

supervisions.notes: The court vacated the sentence of December 20, 2016 for Count 4 and Count 7 and resentenced the defendant.

Transcript-Motion Hearing-08/19/2020

Def appears in custody by video from Wisconsin Secure Program Facility & w/Atty Colleen Marie Marion.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Atty. Marion states defendant waives right to appear in person.  Defendant waives right to appear in person due to COVID-19.  Atty. Marion believes defendant is volutarily waiving right to appear in person.  Court finds at this moment the defendant is freely and voluntarily waiving right to appear in person and the video/audio connections are sufficient.  Discussion on procedure today.  Atty. Marion argues position on Motion, State opposes proceeding and makes argument.  With some reluctance the court is allowing the defendant to testify.  WITNESS:  Sean R. W.  Video disconnect at 9:12 a.m.  Reconnected and reconvened hearing at 9:18 a.m.  Court requests defense submit another brief stating exactily what requesting the court to do and reason why.  Defense shall file brief by noon on 9-21-2020 and State shall file response by noon on 10-26-2020.  Court accepts the defense offer to request the Court of Appeals for 90 days after 10-26-2020 to render a decision.

Def appears in custody by video from Secure Program Facility-Boscobel & w/Atty Timothy Drewa.  Atty Mark David Bensen for State.   Clerk: EZ.  Court advises has not looked at the PSI or the transcript of 2016 sentencig hearing or the Court of Appeals Decision.  Atty. Drewa makes statements in order to refrain from bias in sentencing.  Atty. Drewa request the court order a new PSI and secondly that it be prepared by an agent from another county.  Atty. Drewa also requests that the court specifically state that the agent not include case Static 99.  Atty. Drewa does not oppose the court reading the Court of Appeals Decision and maintains request court not read the prior PSI.  State has no objection to the request of counsel.  Court will comply with the defense requests and  Presentence Investigation Report ordered and the order to include that the PSI be prepared by an agent not from Washington County and not include Static 99 or the previous PSI information.  State shall prepare an otp.  Defendant inquires on immediate pickup right after court.  Atty. Drewa states will contact the defendant to further discuss.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 1, 2019 at 01:30 pm.

Motion to Extend the Time for the Circcuit Court to Decide the Postconviction Motion and Request for Clarification
Def Ex. #5 also was Attachment A to 1/8/18 Motion

Defendant appears in custody & w/Atty. Colleen Marie Marion.  Atty. Stephanie L. Hanson for State.  WITNESSES:  Dr. Nick Yackovich; Detective Eric Grinwald (WBPD); Correctional Officer Randy Berry (WCSD); Correctional Officer Benjamin Bauer (WCSD); Atty. Brian Borkowicz.  Court will render an oral ruling on ineffective assistance of counsel and Miranda Goodchild.  Argument by counsel.  Court finds there is compliance with Miranda.  Court finds the defendant's statements were voluntary and there is no evidence of improper police coercion.  The State has met its burden of demonstrating that Detective Grinwald complied with Miranda and the defendant's waiver was made freely, knowingly and voluntarily.  Court denies motion for ineffective assistance of counsel.  As to the propriety of the DOC consideration of the Static 99R, Court will order the following briefing schedule:  Defense letter brief due 8-15-18; State's response by 8-31-18 and any reply by 9-12-18.  Court will issue written decision by 10-12-18.  Atty. Marion to file an extension.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Brian Michael Borkowicz.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson for State. Matter scheduled for sentencing today. Presentence report is on file and has been reviewed by counsel and defendant. Court concerned about statements of def to PSI author. Case passed to allow counsel and def to discuss whether def wishes to withdraw plea. Case recalled. Atty Borkowicz indicates def intends to file motion to withdraw pleas. Counsel to contact SPD to see if they will appoint him for that purpose. In anticipation of the motion being filed, briefs to be filed as follows: def motion and brief by 10-26-16; State to brief by 11-16-16; Defense reply by 11-23-16. Oral decision on motion scheduled. Transcript of plea hearing to be filed. Atty Borkowicz to notify the court if no motion to withdraw plea will be filed.  Oral ruling scheduled for December 2, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
